I had called the hotel manager about a week before the conversion to Hyatt (September 1st was their "live" date) asking if we could book using our Diamond suite upgrade awards for two nights and pay for the rest. She was very accommodating in obtaining a suite for us during high season. Check in was smooth although the front desk is not quite Hyatt-savvy. The front desk agent was very kind, but really neglected to give us the dog and pony show to which we have become accustomed, especially when it is our first stay at a particular property. Although the manager was helpful with making the reservation, I really believed that as Diamond Passport, they would have pulled out all the stops for us. Not! Not even a welcome letter in our suite! The front desk agent said we have already blocked you a great room! Ha! We were given the lowest level of suite (a lux suite) with a view of the parking lot behind the property! It was also right next to the elevators! It would have been an insult to any Hyatt Diamond. It is important to note that this property is not a view property and a "premium" view would be overlooking First Street in downtown Napa, and maybe, it might have a balcony . . . Ours didn't. Fortunately for us, we didn't need a view or a balcony, but for those who want to have accommodations that overlook the vineyards, gardens or even a pool or water feature, this is not the place for you! On the positive side, the property has a lovely patio area with fire pits where you can order your wine or BYOB and enjoy the crisp air in the evenings and relax after a long day of wine tasting. The hotel also offers some wine tasting events in the evening, a plus if you want even more wine. Service was good, but not great. The concierge was definitely on her game when she was able to get us a much-coveted appointment at Pride Vineyards! I would definitely rely on their concierges for any and all information you might need. There was otherwise very little in personal attention for this boutique hotel. Our suite was sweet, but nothing about which I could rave as others have previously done in their reviews. The bathroom does have a quasi walk-in shower with a rain shower head, but unless you tilt it towards the wall, all the water overflows onto the bathroom floor. You don't even realize it until you step out into a huge puddle! In our bathroom, the toilet faced the windows, so if the drapes were open and you forgot to close the sliding bathroom door, the entire parking lot can see you squat! In addition, the web site shows a lux suite with double sinks, but in ours, there was only one! Breakfast service is very slow. We waited ten minutes for our server to offer us coffee. The weekend buffet is, however, lovely with lots of options including yummy hot items and an egg and omelet station. The applewood smoked bacon and chicken apple sausage are delish! The location is perfect for exploring downtown Napa which has had a massive revitalization since our last visit over six years ago. You can walk to great markets, eclectic shops, wine tasting stores and fabulous four-star restaurants. I think that is the Hyatt Avia's strongest selling point since it definitely does NOT have any of the following amenities that one associates with the typical wine country experience. Nothing near the quaintness and personality of a bed and breakfast or small inn. No luxurious grounds to meander. No spa, although they do have privileges with the fitness center next door. No pool. No hot tub. For $400 per night (that is what we paid for a SUNDAY night stay), I think you can get a lot more bang for your buck in Napa Valley. We were so enamored by the fact that Hyatt finally had a property in the Napa Valley (they have a Hyatt in Santa Rosa which is too far from the main attractions) that I forgot to do my homework! When we returned home, I looked up some of the rates and amenities of comparable properties, like the Westin Napa, and found the rates very similar for the last weekend in October, and the Westin has its own fitness facility, outdoor pool and spa. Are we too spoiled? I think not, given that we stay pretty much exclusively at Hyatt unless there isn't a convenient location. We have expect a certain level of bend over backward-ness as Hyatt Diamond guests. In conclusion, I would by no means discount the Hyatt Avia as a contender when deciding on a property in the Napa area of the Wine Country, but I would seriously consider what amenities are offered before I plunked down my credit card guarantee!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Leomj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights here in September and really enjoyed ourselves. We were in two different rooms, which were different from each other. The decor is done in neutrals with dark wood. The rooms each had a sitting area and sleeping area with a large flatscree TV that swiveled between them. (There is a Benjamin Franklin quote on the wall and in both rooms, two or three letters were missing. There must be a reason but I don't know what it is). The common areas were well done. We did not eat in the restaurant but had breakfast in the bar area several mornings. My husband made use of the concierge more than once and was very pleased with the service. The business center was handy and well done. There was self parking available in the back. The 2nd floor terrace was great; swings, firepits, bar service, group and separate seating. The general location downtown was really convenient. Before we left we had been all over Napa and Sonoma and found getting on the right roads was easy. When we were in for the night, we could self park and then walk wherever for dinner. My major gripe was the view out the window. Our first room looked out at a stucco wall with a narrow srip of sky at the top. We asked for a different room. The view was somewhat better but was of the parking deck. If you keep the drapes drawn, it is no big deal, but if you don't, then be specific about what you are looking for. One other thing; Avia had become a Hyatt property a couple of weeks before we checked in and the entire room cost was charged to my amex a week before we checked in and in a different billing cycle from when we checked out. I am still working on this.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in many ways”
Reviews.Author: BN712
Reviews.Content: Here are a few ways in which Avia Napa met and exceeded my expectations: *Room was very well appointed and clean. The hotel is beautifully decorated throughout. *Concierge was very helpful with recommending some excellent boutique wineries (and making our appointments at the wineries). *Complimentary access to a large fitness facility next door. *Breakfast was delicious. They had a full gourmet buffet on offer, but the waitstaff allowed us to dine a la carte. We selected just an item or two from the buffet and were billed only for those items and coffee, which was a much more economical option for us. The waitstaff were very accomodating. *Great location in downtown Napa ~ walking distance to art galleries, restaurants, shops and the Oxbow Market (***highly recommended***). *Free self-parking. Valet also available. *Friendly greetings from all hotel personnel. And, they were very accomodating of our requests and questions. *We also had an excellent experience at the John Anthony tasting room, which is in the hotel building but the entrance is outside. The appetizers were absolutely delicious. Of course, the wine was great too. The managers and waitstaff were very personable. What more could you ask for?!?! It's been a year since I was there, but this resonates in my memory as an excellent hotel experience, and I'm dying to go back ASAP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: izzy0214
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a hotel you can stay at for awhile. The rooms are nice and spacious with the bed area,bath and TV. There is a seperate sitting/living room with a TV as well. Very comfortable beds and big bathroom with a huge walk in shower. We stayed here one night after touring the wine country. All the restaurants and shops are in walking distance. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. My husband used the gym which is not part of the hotel however it is complimentary for the guests. He said the staff was very friendly at the gym. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Napa, and I plan to stay here again! Great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: whitelaketraveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location downtown. front desk staff was not very professional or helpful on several matters. I also had billing problems that took time to resolve.....I had prepaid room on Hotels.com but they charged me again at checkout and it took too long to straighten it out. Restaurant in lobby is overpriced but the food is good. Hallways are unusually dark and the bathroom lighting is not good. But, the rest of decor is nice, everything is clean and the location makes it hard to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Manager On Duty”
Reviews.Author: Terry K
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Avia Napa Hyatt, 1450 First Street, Napa, California on September 16-17, 2011, revealed some major security flaws, inattention to detail, and extremely appalling behavior by the management who was presented as the face of Hyatt Hotels. The hotel made several errors, starting out with making both our room keys nonfunctional on the second day of our reserved stay, apparently forgetting we were staying another night. Yet the maid had made up the room as if we were staying another night, so I don't actually understand the disconnect. Apparently there was a major miscommunication between departments. We went to Reception to have our room keys reactivated and asked for an explanation as to why they didn’t function. Reception staff gave us two different reasons why it may have happened, from the possibility the batteries in the door lock may have stopped functioning (clearly not the case, but in any case maintenance should be replacing the batteries on a schedule to ensure that couldn’t happen) to the possibility the keys came too close to another credit card. (That has actually always been a myth, credit cards do not have the necessary electromagnetic charge to deactivate other magnetic striped cards.) We asked to speak to a manager, and Paul [--], the Front Desk Manager, gave us the most probable and truthful explanation: the staff member who checked us in the night before had most likely erroneously entered us into the computer system as staying for only one night. That explanation was satisfactory, as simple mistakes sometimes happen. We thanked him, and Reception then issued newly activated key cards to us. But when attempting to unlock our room door with the replacement key cards, we soon discovered they again didn’t work. Reception would tell us later the reissued cards unlocked not our room, but a room a floor above ours. (Imagine the surprise of the occupants if we had actually used them for that room.) Then, while attempting to use the newly issued but erroneous room keys, one of the housekeeping staff let us into our room without ever asking for a name, or identification, or anything, but just because our keys were apparently not working on that room door. (Imagine our surprise if she had done that for someone that wasn't staying in that room.) Both of these incidents are obvious breaches of guest security. We again returned to Reception to have them correct their second error concerning our room key cards. Insisting to speak to a manager, Engineering Manager Sam [--] was presented to us as the Manager On Duty. A Saturday during the peak season in the Napa Valley, and the Engineering Manager, someone who is expert at repairing the air conditioning or an electrical problem is sent to handle our front desk room complaint. The General Manager and Assistant Manager were not in the building, not on duty, we were told. The Front Desk Manager, Paul [--], was suddenly sent on a “work break” and left the building. On a Saturday, in Napa Valley during the peak wine release season. Unbelievable. It immediately became obvious Sam [--]’ plan for handling the complaint was to attempt to bully us into submission. He was combative, argumentative, hostile and demeaning. Arms folded, he looked past us, no eye contact, scowling; his body language couldn’t have been more insulting. He clearly cared nothing about our complaint, except as a nuisance, and he wanted us to just go away. He clearly despised our presence in the lobby of “his” hotel. Sam [--], Manager On Duty, refused to bring front desk manager Paul [--] back from his sudden “work break”, which had begun inexplicably in the middle of the complaint process. We wanted Paul [--] to confirm Sam [--] stated contention we had told Reception we were occupying room 301 rather than 201. We in fact had not, having only shown the reservation confirmation email to identify ourselves initially. The room number was never mentioned, and was presumably ascertained from our room key cards and/or the reservation confirmation email information. We told Sam [--] we were not leaving until Paul [--] came back from his break and we could ask him directly, to his face, if we had ever mentioned any specific room number. We witnessed Paul [--] return from his “break”, but he went directly past us without stopping, into the back office, at Sam [--]’ direction. Our call to him to stop to answer a question went unheeded. Sam [--] then followed Paul [--] into the back office. After a few moments, both Paul [--] and Sam [--] returned to the front desk, and Mr. [--] asserted we told him we were staying in room 301 rather than 201. We asserted this was not true, and he asserted that would be his final testimony on the matter. That was blatantly false testimony, a lie, presumably after being instructed by Sam [--] to do so. However, even if that were the case, reception should have verified our room number prior to issuing keys to that room. What if we had been some kind of criminal element looking to do harm to the occupants of any room in that hotel? Is it sufficient we simply could go to Reception, give a false room number, and get keys to that room issued? Obviously, that is an unacceptable security risk to all occupants of the hotel. We stated we would not leave Reception until we received our final bill indicating the charges for our stay up to that point had been reversed. We were not about to pay any establishment for such insulting treatment, blaming us for their own obvious mistakes, blatantly lying to us about the matter and accusing us, their paying guests, of lying ourselves. We were informed the reception data servers in Omaha had lost contact with the Avia hotel, and no bill could be produced until service was restored. We insisted we would wait until that was accomplished. Sam [--] then threatened us, asking “Do you want me to call the police and have you ‘escorted’ from the hotel property? Because I’ll do it.” There was absolutely no provocation on our part for such a threat. Our voices were never raised during any of the conversation, there was no indication of any threatening move or statement on our part. For the record, I’m a 54 year old man who is 5 feet 2 inches tall and weighs 125 pounds; it is not possible for me to be threatening to anyone. As proof, one only need check the Reception security camera footage for the period of time between approximately 2:30 and 3:00 PM on September 17. You’ll find no provocative actions on our part on the video. There was and continues to be no excuse for such insulting, bullying and unprofessional behavior by any Hyatt employee, especially a manager, the declared most senior manager present on the property. Eventually the server connection to Omaha was restored, and we received our bill indicating we owed the hotel nothing. While no other outcome would be acceptable to us, the behavior of the staff, specifically that of Sam [--], Engineering Manager, remains absolutely unacceptable. Such behavior should not be tolerated within the Hyatt corporation, and is not the professionalism and courtesy we’ve come to expect from Hyatt staff. We understand Hyatt acquired Avia very recently, on September 1 of this year. Perhaps some auditing of the current Avia staff is needed to ascertain if they meet Hyatt standards. It is my contention Sam [--], specifically, does not.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great downtown Napa location”
Reviews.Author: kellyonthego905
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Avia Napa. It's in a great location in downtown Napa within walking distance of good restaurants, shops and lots and lots of wine tasting rooms. The drive into Napa Valley for winery visits is an easy one from this location. I'd say that the customer service was good, with a little room for improvement. The front desk, restaurant and bar staff were all very good, but the valet and bell staff was not so great. They brought the wrong car around twice and were very slow regardless of how busy they were (or weren't!), and some of them were not very pleasant. I'd recommend using the free self-parking instead of valet. We just used valet for convenience but it didn't really pay off. Our room was 321, which was close to the elevator and I had concerns, but we didn't hear any noise from that. The room was a master tub suite, with modern decor, and a separate sitting room from the bedroom. It was clean and nicely appointed. Both the bedroom and sitting room had televisions. Loved the giant bath tub, which is actually in the suite, next to the bathroom, not in it. The large, open-style shower has an overhead raindrop and a regular wall spray.The only reason I'd steer clear of this particular room is that it was right over the outside patio area and people hung out there and were kind of loud. They also have live music but it was over early enough not to interfere with trying to sleep. We had breakfast in the restaurant twice. The regular menu was fine and reasonably priced. The weekend buffet, however, was not great and they didn't replenish the fruit. The buffet is the only choice on the weekend. We stopped at the bar for some wine (go figure) flights and the bartender was very personable and knowledgeable about what he was serving. There's no gym in the hotel, but they provide you with complementary access to the ExerTec which is right next door, so it's like having a gym in the hotel anyway. I'd stay here again, and I'd recommend to friends and family. Love the location!

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic in downtown Napa!”
Reviews.Author: Philygirl4ever
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the AVIA Napa. What a beautiful hotel in walking distance to some wonderful restaurants. Hotel rooms were big, modern and clean. Hotel itself doenst have a gym but guests are given complimentary passes to the gym two doors down. Easy access to the gym and to a free parking lot where we kept our car overnight all three nights. Valet parking was available for $15 per night. Streets are a little confusing because many are one-way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa Base Camp”
Reviews.Author: ear4jc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Comfortable accomadations, nice people, reasonable food prices.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: kw_loves2travel
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. All the features, details and architecture made it a truly unique hotel to stay at. The only thing I didn't like about it and the reason for a 4 instead of 5 was the bathroom door...good idea to have it save space and be a slider...but the gap between the door and the wall didn't leave much room for privacy when trying to do your business ;) There is a really nice terrace that has a fire pit at night. The front desk staff were friendly, professional and efficient. The hotel was walking distance to lots of restaurants, which was a plus after traveling on the Napa Valley Wine Train all day. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay there again when visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff and Delicious Chocolate Soup!”
Reviews.Author: JMSinMEM
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at AVIA in Napa. Cool spot, great room, super staffing! Cool roof top bar with fire pits - try the chocolate soup!

Reviews.Title: “This is now a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: traveledfar
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms over Labor day weekend. Both were master tub suites with a large bathtub in the room. The bathroom was large as was the terrific shower. We were very happy and the hotel very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. It is in downtown Napa. We usually stay in Yountville at Bardessamp but would return here again for the diffence in price they were asking. We walked to Celadon restaurant which was delicous. Ask to sit outside by the fire place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot”
Reviews.Author: 7travelling7
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel - only negative was housekeeping knocking on the door not once but twice, after we requested a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: e w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights over the fourth of July weekend. It had a new, modern and clean look to it but still had the wine country feel. The rooms were a decent size with 2 flat screen t.v.'s and a seperate seating area. We loved the outdoor patio/deck with the fireplace, it was a very nice area to relax and have a drink. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was good but a bit on the pricey side. The staff was helpful and accommodating. The had a valet service but we took advantage of the free parking which was literally right behind the hotel. The location was great and nice area to come back to after visiting the wineries all day. The only downside; there wasn't a pool like many of the other resorts offered. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our go to hotel when in Napa”
Reviews.Author: LexidocNY
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Avia twice and will stay again. We go to Napa several times year tp visit our daughter. The Avia is right in town and if that is where you want to be located you wont find better accommodations in the town of Napa. The decor is sleek modern with an Asian accent. The rooms are large and the bed is very, very comfortable. There is free use of a great gym half a block away, free parking (or valet if you prefer not to do it yourself) and a lovely outdoor deck. The ambience is peaceful and tasteful. There are many, many excellent restaurants in walking distance, such as Oenotri, Morimoto, Tyler Florence, Bounty Hunter,.. Others and wineries are an easy drive. Dont miss Oxbow market in Napa, a nice walk or short drive from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BruceAMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of downtown, walking distance to everything, rooms and staff were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and fabulous hotel in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: beckyjane_81
Reviews.Content: We booked the AVIA Napa for a long weekend in Napa. We looked all over for affordable hotels or homes to rent with no luck. AVIA is located in the heart of downtown Napa and walkable to great restaurants. It is quiet on the weekends which is nice when trying to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: StoneflyBri
Reviews.Content: Came to Napa for a wine-tasting weekend and selected the Avia Hotel. The bell service was fantastic--front desk and bar service not as much.The Hotel is top-notch beauty--the second floor seating and fire pit area with bar was extremely well done and the exterior look and design of the hotel is aesthetically pleasing. My spouse and I got a standard room which we both felt was a little small, but the bathroom made up for that in design, beauty and functionality with all the marble and the rain-can/handheld shower heads. We both thought the level of lighting in the hallway was a bit too low (lights shining upwards from behind rectangular mirrors). We walked to dinner the first night and to breakfast the next morning. That weekend there was a big craft fare going on which we didn't attend but was also within walking distance.Very nice hotel but a bit pricey for the overall value.

Reviews.Title: “AVIA/Hyatt had better improve on Customer service and attentiveness!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan S
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there and can say the rooms were pretty nice, but beware of some with NO VIEW whatsoever! The front desk staff as well as room service seemed to care less whether we enjoyed our stay or not?? I can't see going back to AVIA unless things improve dramatically. A Hyatt....err...uhhh....well I just hope Hyatt can work things out at this location, because it is a good location, and modern...just that at the present time there are much better places to spend your money than at this pretentious place!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel451
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty here and had a wonderful experience over an extended Labor Day Holiday. We stayed 3 nights. My boyfriend (now fiancé) told the hotel he was going to propose that weekend so they set up reservations in advance for us to top notch restaurants (Redd, Mustard) and wine tastings. Even though the hotel was at full capacity they put us in one of the best rooms/best views in hotel ahead of time. They also sent a bottle of Chandon champagne to our room to toast to our engagement. The concierge ladies (Jenny and Pamela) were wonderful! They went above and beyond to make our stay special. Even the hotel staff were extremely helpful and had excellent service. We stayed in the king master tub balcony suite overlooking First Street. The room was top notch from the comfy bed to the dual sided flat panel tvs and fireplace to the giant terrace balcony. Very clean, very spacious. You also get free gym passes which is next to the hotel and has plenty of treadmills, weights, and cardio-even classes along with a sauna, steam room, etc. The breakfast buffet wasn't cheap ($17/person plus tip) but was well worth it. The food quality was excellent and the spread of food was great. There are fireplaces throughout the hotel which was great on a cool night. The only negative I can think of is no hot tub or pool. The fire pits and cabannas were cool but there were so many people out there it was hard to enjoy a quiet moment. Glad we got the room with a balcony. The price was $399/night during the weekend and $309 Monday. That isn't bad at all for a 4 diamond AAA hotel on a holiday weekend in Napa. The location was perfect and there were a ton of great restaurants, nightlife, and shops on our street and a 10 minute walk from Oxbow Market. The wineries are very close driving distance. I wouldn't stay anywhere else as that part of Napa has so much to do and is new and nice. Also I can't imagine any hotel or inn being as spacious and new as Avia so I wouldn't risk staying elsewhere. However, Hyatt did just buy Avia so perhaps in the future there could be changes so we'll see. Overall..5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa Retreat”
Reviews.Author: JazzDK
Reviews.Content: Great room with tub in room...makes for relaxing evenings after exploring all day. Room is beautiful and modern. Location great...can walk to all restaurants and public market in Napa. Easy access to highway to get to other towns.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Pigandeel
Reviews.Content: I stay at home with two preschoolers and went stayed here for a quick getaway to refresh and rejuvenate. The hotel fit the bill. I called when I drove into town to see if there were rooms available. The young man who took my call was very helpful and very friendly. When I arrived he greeted me, introduced me to the front desk and expertly answered some questions I had. The front desk person was also very friendly and helpful. I was offered a bigger room at the price of a smaller room and took it. The room was well maintained and very clean. I called for room service and was unable to reach anyone. I called several times before calling the front desk. The front desk person was apologetic and helped me right away by finding the room service person and then connecting me - excellent customer service. The room service person was helpful and friendly as well. The food arrived quickly although was just average for room service food. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel, the room, and the people who were working the evening I checked in. I would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was chic but the policy at hotel was not customer service friendly”
Reviews.Author: BLKing
Reviews.Content: We had a living room suite on the 4th floor. Beware of lower floors - you might have a structure as a view. The room was nice and the buffet breakfast was well worth the $16.00. I would have rated the hotel higher, except we wanted to check out a day early - it was Sunday and the hurricane had just gone right over our house in New York. We called 30 minutes after the noon checkout to the front desk and we were told we could not check out since the noon deadline was past. Then we were told we could pay 50% or $140 for the 30 minutes extra in the room - maid service hadn't even come yet to clean the room! That was a real turn off. We didn't plan for a hurricane going right over our house. They said we had to plan our trip better. LIsa (the manager on duty), really?!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Napa. We hope to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Tempo2
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Avia. Wonderful part of town for easy walking and dining. The room was nice and bright and the beds were very comfortable. We drove to the vineyards each day and were excited to return to our lovely accommodations. Make sure you visit the terrace outside in the evening. You can sit by the fire with your own wine, and visit with the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sarbek
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Avia while we were visiting the Napa Valley. We were there with our 18m old daughter and the staff went above and beyond to accomodate for us in terms of warm milk and food restrictions for our daughter. The concierge got us reservations at "Auberge du soleil" which was 'booked' according to an online booking site. We had a great stay and very much enjoyed the hotel/room and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “BIG $$ for little frills....”
Reviews.Author: kellyagogo
Reviews.Content: While in San Fran for business my husband & I decided to spend a day in Napa. We travel to Napa/Sonoma yearly. We thought we would try the new Avia Hotel. It was not what we envisioned. Our suite w/tax was $379 nightly. I had called the day prior to inquire about early check-in and was told 'NO', instantly. We arrived at 2:30 and attempted to check-in and with no eye contact from the from desk attendants, we were told no, and not before 4 pm. Traveling monthly, and in the hospitality business I understand being busy and fully booked, however, I also understand, ALL rooms are not instantly available at 4 pm. We were told we could leave our number and they would cal us when our suite became available. Our phone didn't ring. We returned at 4:30 and our room was ready. We got to our room and the keys didn't work: back to the front desk, stand in-line, show id, rekey cards......finally in our room. Open the drapes and we have a 5 story solid cement wall the length of the hotel. What a view! and I paid $375 for it. We were told they have 'free tastings' from 5-6pm with food pairing from the chef. We got ready for dinner and went to the free tasting, which is hosted by a local vineyard, so no expense to the hotel, except for the food pairings, which NEVER appeared. In summary the pictures look good in the advertizements, but my money can get me more bang for the buck at any number of establishments in the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Thanesmith
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I've avoided staying in Napa when visiting wine country. The hotels and B and B's are just too expensive and pretentious. I fell in love with Avia Napa, the relaxed, yet chic decor. Great room service, casual wine bar and helpful staff. The location in the heart of downtown is perfect, and if a special is on, or it's not a busy weekend, the rates are relatively less expensive than some other places. We had a fireplace suite, upgraded, and I must admit I'm spoiled for anything else now.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruzr412
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel in the heart of downtown Napa. Top notch place if you desire to stay in the Napa area, that provides good access to all of the areas attractions. I only wish the hotel had it's own gym and pool facilities. This would have made it a top pick for me.

Reviews.Title: “Not a single thing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMae9
Reviews.Content: My husband calls me a hotel snob. In fact, during our visit to Napa valley, I checked out of a subpar hotel in Calistoga after one night to try the Avia. What a good decision! It's a rare occasion that I stay in a hotel room that I don't have a complaint about. This hotel was quite splendid! The room and bathroom were huge and very clean, the bed was comfortable, and the hotel was very modern. The only complaint I've read from other reviewers about this hotel is that the town of Napa isn't as quaint as the rest of Napa Valley. I agree, but given the value of this upscale hotel and the fact that one can get from Napa all the way to Calistoga in less than an hour, it's a great place to sleep while exploring this beautiful part of California.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced but still a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramfan_09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights while touring Napa. A very nice hotel in a good location in Napa. Really enjoyed the outdoor terrace in the evenings after dinner. At 5:00, they have free wine tastings in the bar and on the terrace so you can try two different wine makers. We met a lot of nice people sitting out by the fire pits in the evening, a great place to relax and talk. Rooms were nice with a separate living area with a couch. It was very quiet and we didn't hear too much inside or outside the hotel. There was a mini fridge offering wine, beer and pop for a fee. They don't have a full bar, which I would expect from an upscale hotel. Didn't appear to have a liquor license yet that covered anything past beer or wine. Overall I really liked the place. Not sure it's worth $350+ per night given the lack of some services but it was still a good place to visit. Probably should be placed in the $250 range for the service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jacquie m
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit small but very modern and great ambiance. It's one of the newer, nicer hotels in Napa that is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Napa”
Reviews.Author: sn0wb0under
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this boutique hotel in the center of Napa. The check in staff was a little iffy, we arrived at 12:30 and were told that no rooms were available and we couldn't check in until 4:00. They would hold our bags and took our phone number and sent us on our way. We had a nice lunch across the street at the Norman Rose and took a short walk around Napa. We decided around 2:00 to go back to the hotel, the check in staff had changed over and what do you know a room was available. The room itself was great, big comfortable bed, flat screen that you could swivel to watch from bed or the sitting room, large bathroom. Bathroom door is barn door style, so not much privacy and makes a racket in the middle of the night, but other than that the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful property and service but park your own car”
Reviews.Author: KellyD67
Reviews.Content: My June trip to Avia was my second stay this year. My wife and her mother stayed early in 2011 and had a bit of a mishap involving the hotel valet service that resulted in a scratched bumper. Before it was noticed, she had already booked another one night stay in early April for her birthday. The April birthday trip was fantastic. We were still dealing with the damaged car issue at that time but ultimately were later offered compensation for the minor damage in the form of a check to repair the car or a stay at the hotel. After our April overnight stay the decision was easy. Who needs a perfect bumper anyhow? Our two night weekend stay in June was over the top. We arrived at the beautiful room to a bottle of champagne and a note from the property manager Kristine. Nice classy move. We explored the downtown area and found a variety of incredible places to eat and drink all within walking distance. Of all the food and drink, the most memorable was the antipasto platter from the hotel. Holy cheese! Some of the best meats and cheese I have had ever and I am a cheese lover. The property is amazing, the bar is nice, the deck area is fantastic and cozy. We were joined by friends who drove up for the day and had an incredible time on the deck and exploring nearby tasting rooms and restaurants. Bottom line: We will return anytime we need a nearby getaway. TIP: Park your own car right around the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, ideal location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Red8711
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I just left Avia Napa where we spent the first part of our honeymoon. From the minute we waked in, the service was impeccable. The rooms were spacious and clean... The concierge Juliet made sure every place we visited was special... Most importantly, she introduced us to Dave Locke from consort wine tours,.. He picked us up in a beautiful escalade...served us chapagne...took us to little family owned wineries who welcomed us like family...then Dave served us lunch in the vineyards! What a magical experience! Best food right near the hotel... Just a walk away... Angele..Celedon...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ljo18
Reviews.Content: we stayed her for our honeymoon and enjoyed out stay. good location, we were able to walk to lots of restaurants and a few downtown wineries. the outside patio was beautiful and a great place to have a glass of wine before we headed to dinner or a nightcap when we returned. the staff was helpful and friendly. the rooms where great and the bed was comfortable. the only downfall was our room was directly over the patio and one morning we left our windows open and were awoken early to the staff setting up for a private event.

Reviews.Title: “A special stay! Clean, new & beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauren4316
Reviews.Content: This hotel was new, clean, beautifully decorated with a modern vibe. Rooms aren't too large but the bathroom was huge! Very cool rooms def worth the money, I payed around $200 a night during the week and it was worth it. Great service!!! Close to really nice restaurants :) my only complaint is that we couldn't rent a movie on from the TV. We called and they said they would bring a DVD player up with some movies. It was kinda wierd. They took forever to come so we called to cancel it. Other than that I have no complaints :) I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DStepler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Even though it is not a family style hotel our 2 kids (7 & 10 ) thought it was really cool! Great bathrooms & amazing beds. Never seen a "double king" room before - perfect for families. Would definitely stay again when we come back to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in napa!”
Reviews.Author: CarteBlancWine
Reviews.Content: Great location, exceptional service. Had a regular room first night then upgraded to presidential suite. Everyone at the hotel provided great service, especially the concierge who helped me with helicopter, limousine and dinner bookings. They have a main street fair right in front of hotel and several fantastic restaurants within walking distance. I have stayed at most of the higher rated hotels in wine country but this was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Naps tour”
Reviews.Author: TravelbeeSantaFe_NM
Reviews.Content: Some romantics might like seclusion, but my friend and I found this just the ticket. It is great to come "home" in the afternoon, cool off, enjoy a wine on the terrace and walk without concern for drinking to a downtown restaurant. The concierge helped us arrange difficult bookings weeks before we arrived and treated us like old friends. Turndown with two bottles of water to wash the day away. What's with complaints about parking? Have people never lived in cities? Eat breakfast down the street. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: denizenRichmond_VA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "master tub suite" and the room was very nice - it did in fact look just like the pictures on the website with contemporary furnishings and soothing colors. The soaking tub was comfortable for two and the separate shower and bathroom were very spacious. The bed and linens were comfortable and the room was quiet. The hotel had a very comfortable level of service - as much or as little as you wanted and everyone was very friendly and helpful. Although some reviews and travel books I've seen mentioned negative things about Napa as a town, we liked it. There were cute shops, lots of nice restaurants and bars, and pretty, walkable streets. Apparently, a lot of work has been done since it flooded some years back. It may not be a typical tiny California wine town, but I wouldn't consider it very "urban" either. The hotels also seem to be a much better value than in places like Yountville. I think we got a much nicer room for the price at Avia than we would have in the picturesque wine towns. Avia also has a nice location within walking distance of everything in the town. We did not try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fine boutique hotel in downtown Napa...”
Reviews.Author: john3489
Reviews.Content: We ended our trip to Northern California with a stay at AVIA Hotel in Napa. This hotel is a gem - real boutique feel, snazzy rooms, fantastic shower, very contemporary and hip furnishings in the room and lobby. A great open Terrace on the 2nd floor for relaxing outdoors. All this right in the middle of a much improved, beautifully redone City of Napa. We were impressed at all the changes downtown. AVIA is steps away from many fine restaurants - no driving needed. Walk along the river for an enjoyable after-dinner visit to the new downtown area. Valet car service and front desk personnel were welcoming and efficient. There is a large safe in the closet for computers, etc. We dined nearby at Allegria in a former bank building and had a great meal. Very impressed - will be back, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern feel with character all around”
Reviews.Author: eightrays
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful in providing things to do and places to check out. The room we stayed in felt small but it had a great modern feel to it and had a comfortable bed. We had a view of the patio with the fireplace which was nice and provided a lot light during the day. It's a very well decorated hotel with different spots you can just hang out in. Although it was pricey, I would have to recommend this place for the ambiance and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at Avia again, in Napa or elswhere”
Reviews.Author: LolaMcQueen
Reviews.Content: Avia is a boutique hotel in the heart of downtown Napa. The decor is upscale/modern with a whimsical twist. Each room is designed and furnished differently. Wonderful brunch in the morning. Concierge was extremely helpful with sending us off on our way up north start our wine tasting excursion.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential but not for a perfectionist”
Reviews.Author: NYCHoya
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is really beautiful. The lobby is very nice, the rooms are great, aesthetically, it is a very pleasing hotel. The location is also an added bonus as you can walk to top quality restaurants near by. The hotel comes with several flaws though: 1) The dining options are sub-par. The menu is very limited and the room service menu is even more limited. I went to dinner at the restaurant and there were two entrees! What kind of restaurant has only two entrees?? Also, it was completely vacant at 8pm, there was one couple in the entire restaurant which was a big turn off. Fortunately, there are great dining options nearby since Avia's don't quite cut it. 2) No pool. There is an indoor pool at the free gym next door but no pool to dip your toe into after a long day of wine tasting. Kind of a bummer. 3) The staff while very nice is in desperate need of training. I was told contradictory things on multiple occasions. Someone said there would be live music, but when I got to the patio, I found out it wasn't happening. I'd ask for nearby breakfast places and got contradictory responses. Worst, I asked for my car to be ready and they just forgot about my request and I had to wait 15 minutes which was a huge pain considering that we had a flight to catch. 4) They are doing construction and room upgrades during the weekend. I don't want to see people moving furniture in the hotel and using a passenger elevator as a freight elevator - super tacky! Do this during off peak times. So while I think Avia has great potential, it really needs improvement on the service and dining side for me to consider staying there again. I'd give it 3.5 starts. If you get a great deal OR don't care about dining and excellent service, then this place is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great potential”
Reviews.Author: mosrm
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Avia Napa. It is on first street within walking distance of several restaurants and some limited shopping. The hotel is nice from the outside, the lobby is very modern, trendy and very nice. The rooms are nice, too. We had a king tub suite. The tub is basically in the bedroom. I thought it was strange but if you are into sitting in a tub in the bedroom you will like this. The room was divided by a wall and fireplace with a sitting area on the other sde. Nice touch, but not big. The shower was very large and the bathroom space was good. I would call these room accommodations a 3.5 to 4 star quality. Above average but not great. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, however they seemed to lack training. One morning I sat at the coffee bar in the lobby where someone was supposed to be making latte's etc. There was a machine and all the evidence of a coffee bar but no one to service it. We ate breakfast at the hotel once and it was just a bit unorganized, from being seated to being waited on and getting coffee refills it just wasn't a smooth process. Hyatt has purchased this small chain of hotels and my feeling is that they will train the staff which will take this hotel up to a 4 and even 5 star facility. Like I said, it has potential. The terrace bar is beautiful, but it only serves wine and beer as does the bar in the lobby. So if you want a mixed drink you have to find someplace else. I don't think we will stay here again because there are so many great places to stay in wine country. However, after Hyatt takes control of this property I would recommend giving it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Jaynieepoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Modern furnishing, very comfortable bed. The deck had swings and a fire pit where you can relax and order drinks and food. Walking distance to many restaurants and tasting rooms. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: cocoruns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with another couple as part of a get-away. Service was excellent down to the tiny details with recommendations from the concierge, front desk help getting some letters mailed, and great running route tips from doorman. We stayed in a room with a jacuzzi tub and loved it. We definitely will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: BeeHYW
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, free wifi connection, nice rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't quite cut it”
Reviews.Author: BrightonianMiss
Reviews.Content: We wound up a long road trip around California with a stay at the Avia Napa, hoping for a bit of downtime and relaxation before our return flight to the UK. The hotel is well-situated and relatively new, and our Master Tub Suite was spacious and comfortable (spoiled just a little by a sorry view of the rear of the neighbouring Safeway supermarket.). The valet parking staff and porters were personable and helpful, offering useful tips for eating and drinking nearby (big thanks to the young man who recommended Morimoto for our evening meal - it was wonderful.). But from there it all seemed to go inexplicably downhill. We'd both arranged to get massages (after three weeks driving around in a cramped convertible we were more than ready for these) and had enlisted the help of the 'concierge service' here. Inexplicably, the duty concierge subsequently took it upon herself to cancel one of our massages, meaning that another had to be arranged at very short notice, for a later time. This knocked our whole evening out of sync, and rendered the 'relaxation' element of the enterprise somewhat redundant. We had also asked for some help in arranging a tour of the Frog's Leap Winery, which we were very keen to visit, but were told by the same concierge that this would not be possible. She did not offer any alternatives, though we had asked for some (by email, prior to our arrival) if Frog's Leap turned out to be full, so more time was wasted as we sorted out some visits under our own steam, the last of which turned out to be...Frog's Leap, who kindly fitted us in on the last tasting of the day - which begged the question of how hard the concierge had actually tried in the first place. Most of the staff were, to be fair, perfectly pleasant and helpful, though at breakfast there seemed to be a discrepancy between the vast numbers of waiters buzzing around and the actual service being delivered - we had to ask for coffee three times! The receptionist allocating tables at breakfast also struck a discordant note, with a somewhat disdainful manner that jarred. Eye contact costs nothing, Miss! One further detail that disappointed was that free internet wireless connection is only available in-room for a limited time - after that you have to pay, or use a public computer on the first floor. This is particularly mean-spirited in a hotel so visibly aiming to provide a 'high end' experience. We did feed back our comments directly to the hotel, and received an emailed assurance that our disappointments were taken most seriously and would be investigated, but that was the last we heard, back in May. Hopefully, staff training has been tightened up a little and the concierge service given something of an overhaul...but I guess we'll never know. My feeling is that next time we're in that part of California, we'll head straight for Sonoma and stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel in the Heart of Downtown Napa!”
Reviews.Author: bmmr1
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at AVIA Napa. The AVIA offered many amenities to a highly rated restaurant, full service bar to an outdoor patio with fire pit. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful with restaurant suggestions and making reservations. The hotel is centrally located in Napa and within walking distance to several restaurants. The room was spacious and very clean. Valet parking is helpful in unloading and loading luggage. The next time we are in Napa, we will be staying at the AVIA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: btran321
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with awesom fire pits on the back deck. Room was kind of small.

Reviews.Title: “Quality rooms, quality place”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaBrownsBackers
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the room, and entire stay. If you are in Napa area, a must. Be sure to visit Domaine Chandon in Yountville!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wilstan
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the accommodations were clean and well appointed. The location in downtown Napa was convenient to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracks99
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this wonderful location in Napa Valley. Great loacation for our first time visit. Bellmen were very helpful in providing directions and recommendations on eating. The free wine tasting at the bar was also great. One thing they could provide with the wine tasting would be some light appetizers, cheese and crackers at the least. The room was nice size, and the bathroom was good size, rooms for both of us to use at the same time. Our luggage was delayed by the airline, and did nto arrive at the hotel until way past midnight, but the staff provide us with a goody bag, and they had extra phone chargers as well. Eveyr trip to Napa Valley will be spent at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of Napa”
Reviews.Author: marblehead_prospects
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at Avia Napa earlier this week (2 night stay) and we loved it. I'm not sure whether or not we got an unusually good rate for our mid-week stay but I must say that I was pleasantly surprised by how posh this hotel was for what I would consider to be a very reasonable rate compared to everything else we looked at in Napa/Yountsville. The room: We opted to upgrade to the Master Tub Suite for $20 more/night and it was totally worth it! The suite had a two-sided fireplace that separated two distinct spaces for living/sleeping. Both sides of the fireplace also featured a large flatscreen TV above it. I also took advantage of the HUGE soaking tub which sits just outside the bathroom (where the equally huge shower, vanity and toilet reside) so you can actually sit in the soaking tub and either watch TV or enjoy the fireplace. There is a curtain you can close around the tub but if you were looking for privacy from the rest of the suite, the semi-transparent curtain won't deliver. Hotel overall: The hotel overall was also very hip/modern. We didn't eat at any of the onsite restaurants so I can't comment on those but we were a little disappointed to find out upon check-in that the advertised "free wine tastings every evening" didn't apply Sunday-Wednesday. The other thing that we noticed was (as another reviewer noted) it seemed that the hotel was lacking in staff in some areas. For example, we attempted to visit the 2nd floor veranda/fire pit bar but there was nobody tending to the bar and yet there were dirty dishes/wine glasses everywhere. We actually went back out the next morning and the dishes were still unattended to which was unfortunate because it certainly didn't make you want to sit down and enjoy it. The other two things to be aware of with this hotel are that 1.) there isn't a pool and 2.) there isn't an on-site fitness facility (you can, however visit the gym nearby for free.) Again, not the end of the world for us but I was a bit surprised that a hotel that has so much else to offer would not offer such basic amenities. Location: The location of the hotel was great-- very central to Napa and within walking distance to many restaurants, shops, the wine train, etc. Be aware that Napa itself is transitioning a bit so although it seems very safe it's not (yet) as much of an up-scale yuppie of a town as Yountsville, for example. Having said that, there are lots of very upscale shops/restaurants especially along the riverfront if that's what you're looking for. But if you're like us you might appreciate that because it's not quite as up-scale of a town there are lots more reasonably priced restaurants to choose from within walking distance. Our favorite place that we visited was the Oxbow Public Market. You simply MUST check this place out if you visit Napa... a great place to grab breakfast/lunch. Also check out ZuZu for dinner (tapas)... delish! Overall Experience: Overall we really enjoyed our stay at Avia so although I debated between giving it 4 or 5 stars ultimately I came back to value for the money and (assuming it stays reasonably priced) I wouldn't hesitate to give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and helpful team, central location and modern”
Reviews.Author: montegrappa
Reviews.Content: We found the Avia through recommendations in Trip Adviser. We were not disappointed as the location is so central and convenient, the selection of shops and restaurants within walking distance are best in class and most importantly, the team at Avia are simply the friendliest, most welcoming and helpful of any hotel we have stayed at. Pamela made contact with us a week or so before our arrival to offer the services often concierge team, which we did use. They were fabulous. Upon our arrival, Alex greeted us and assisted us with our bags and led us tote reception desk with a wonderful friendly manner and conversation. My wife and daughter thought he was just wonderful. The hotel is very modern in its livery and style, which we appreciated. It's not stuffy, but very comfortable, yet not standard in the co our scheme and choice of furniture. We felt very comfortable, whether in the room, at the wine bar, in the kitchen area or in the 2nd floor atrium area. Lauri was so helpful to us with assistance in handling some documents, as was Juliette in helping us locate some medical assistance. The hotel is located on first street, which contains a wonderful selection of shops and restaurants. The Oenotri is great for a special dinner,the Norman Rose tavern is great for a lunch and drink, Allegria was fabulous for dinner and Coles Chop house was the highlight for dinner. All of these world class restaurants are within easy walking distance ranging from across the road to 6 minutes walking time. So convenient. Across the road are located two ATM's, the Wells Fargo charges $5 for a withdrawal, while around the corner at the bank of America, the charge is $3 per transaction. The car park is located around the back the hotel and allows for free car ark on level 3 or above in Avia marked spaces. The hotel also provides free wireless Internet, which we found so wonderful as we each had our iPad's and were able to stay in touch. This is such a fresh feeling and unique hotel. We would definitely stay here again if we return to the Napa If you would like a well informed and friendly guide around wineries, we can highly recommend Dan Dolan at Reserve wine tours.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Daisy0429
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 night /June 20-21st, 2011/. Hotel is modern and just beautiful. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Room was a bit small, but exceptionally clean and had a comfy king size bed. Large bathroom with an amazing shower. Check in as well as check out was a breeze. Location couldn’t be better - very close /walking distance/ to many wonderful restaurants and shops. Super fitness center across the street. We’ll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, perfect location, roomy!”
Reviews.Author: kchen24
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights, it was clean and fresh every night we returne from our day! Amazing and friendly staff!! Defitnitely a winner for those who are not into the bed and breakfast style lodging!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drewseph
Reviews.Content: The interior design was modern and very well done. The lobby was really cool. Our room was bright and spacious. The swivel TV was also a unique feature. Free parking and internet! There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. For a cheap lunch, the Small World Restaurant was excellent. For a nice dinner, Grace's Table. For an inexpensive late night dinner, Bistro Sabor. The pork pupusas and fresh churros with caramel were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “a pretty surprise in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: salsacapri
Reviews.Content: We were on a business trip to San Francisco Google Headquarter and decided to just chill prior at Napa Valley for a day during the weekend. It was rainy and cool last week, but the hotel welcomed us with such funky attitude. A rare boutique hotel in such an area, absolutely love the contemporary design feel. Front Desk and Concierge were pretty efficient and helpful, my colleague and I were put on the wine train for the evening ride pretty fast. Having been to European vineyards, I am not expecting much from the California ones, however, Avia Napa serves as a great getaway from the hustle and bustle of the cities with a fashionable touch. The only disadvantage is that there are no twin room, so we have to share a queen bed in a standard room. But the bed was with such good quality that you can sink in comfort but will not disturb your partner sleeping next to you! Love the Bose Sound System and the coffee machine in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa location, walk to anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: sschroeder
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent 3 nts/4 days at the beautiful property. Our initial experiences were all positive. The front desk was efficient, car valet was more than willing to assist us with luggage, and the concierge had all of the information we needed for a great vacation in the Napa Valley. We were on the fourth floor in a Lux room which was very modern and efficient, the bedding was great, good flat screen TV and a really cool bathroom layout. We did not eat any meals here. For breakfast we walked 3 blocks to the supermarket and picked up bagels, milk, etc. and kept them in the room's fridge. The Wine Train is only minutes away , also. At night we walked all over downtown very easily for the hotel is located in the heart of the action. overall a great experience, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avia Napa”
Reviews.Author: MM626
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel!! We stayed in a suite and it was one of the nicer rooms we've ever stayed in, anywhere. The guys at the front door were fantastic, no matter what time of day, the bartenders were always superb in the lobby bar, and hotel employees were always friendly whenever you ran into them around the premises. One gap we found was with the front desk staff (during the afternoon.) One of them was a little "stand-offish", which might just be someone trying to maintain an air of sophistication which the hotel deserves, but a smile would help. Another, when we were checking in explained to us how "stressed she was". Sorry, don't care. All in all a GREAT hotel, just need them to loosen up, up front.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Welcome to a Lovely Town”
Reviews.Author: WillR79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the AVIA Napa for two nights in May and had an amazing time in the small town of Napa. The hotel looked fantastic with really helpful staff and was in a great location. Facilities were brilliant- the shower and bathroom were especially amazing! We had a agreat time in Napa going oon a hot air balloon trip and a wine tour- both of which we would strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Excellence”
Reviews.Author: ErinLG
Reviews.Content: Avia is an ultra modern hotel, located right in the heart of Napa's downtown. Great location and amenities, unlike any other hotel I had seen. Concierge was available throughout the day and was very knowledgeable of which Wineries specialized in which types of wines as well as which required appointments for tasting and which were public. This saved us a lot of time locating our top priorities to visit. Rooms were comfortable and quiet, but the lobby was a social scene in the evenings. Nice mix! Food in the restaurant was very good and the ambiance was relaxed. Really a great hotel. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LERinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avia for a couple of nights tacked on to a trip to SF. We wish we had spent our entire trip here! Fabulous hotel! Clean, amazingly well appointed and the tub -- the tub was amazing! We had told them ahead of time that we were on our do-over honeymoon and upon arrival they brought us a bottle of champagne. A very nice touch. We had an great time in Napa and the hotel was definitely a big part of it. Only downside was the parking lot -- a bit of a hike and there was some broken glass that made us nervous about the safety of the lot, but we had no problems with it. Can't wait to head back to Napa and stay at the Avia again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: 2WestCoastLovers
Reviews.Content: Pros - -Easy, free parking right behind the hotel -Comp chair massage in the lobby at check in -Comp wine tasting at the bar each night from 5-6 -Beautiful bar area, lobby and rooms -Awesome concierge service!!! -Wine bar right next door to the hotel is wonderful too! Cons - The Avia Restaurant / dining room looks just like a "hotel" dining room - no ambiance - not inviting. The bar area is much swankier / cozier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Napa Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisaseawa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to Napa this week. We stayed three nights at the Avia hotel in downtown Napa, which was absolutely beautiful. We were extremely impressed by the lobby staff, in particular, Nicole who checked us in and upgraded our room to a gorgeous suite that had a wonderful view. My husband and I celebrated a 10 year anniversary on this trip. The room had two flat screen TVs, a deep soaking tub (with a view of downtown Napa). Bedding was lush and plush. Walking distance to great shops, wine tasting venues, restaurants, etc. 9 mile drive to Yountville foodie stops. We will absolutely return to Avia on a future visit and would recommend the hotel for couple's looking for an upscale, but non-pretentious stay in a wonderful Napa location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: BluesDoctor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Avia for three nights. Quite pleased with the room and decor. Modern approach to the hotel's design was really nice. The rooms were kept clean and everything was in working order. My only complaint was that the AC unit is one that has the compressor in the wall of the bedroom resulting in a sound of the compressor kicking in and a blowing noise at various times during the night. I am a light sleeper so I was awoken several time during the night. Of course, with all the nice wines I tried I was able to go right back to sleep! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, staff needs better training”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool, modern hotel in an area dominated by B&B's and resorts of one faux design type or another. It is right in the city of Napa, which if you have not been to the valley before is not really the center of things. If you picutre a town in the Napa valley, you're picturing St. Helena or Yontville, not Napa. Napa is a nice enough town, though much of it holds little interest to tourists and is really the industrial working part of the wine business. All that said, if you want a good base from which to explore, or you have business in Napa, and you want a cool hotel with good food and huge nice rooms, this is it. I've stayed here a few times now and will keep coming back whenever I have business in Napa. There are however, a few shortcomings. First, the hotel staff is very, very nice and they are really trying to be helpful. However, I think their training must fall somewhat short as basic things often go by the boards. Things like no change at the front desk, which is irritating, especially if you're trying to tip someone. I noted the valets, again super nice guys trying hard, didn't know directions to other hotels/meeting facilities that turned out to be 5 minutes drive away. It's tough to blame them as the concierge didn't know either and by the time both trying looking it up, I had it on my phone and was on my way. Lastly, no one should have to have a phone ring 50+ times to order room service. This has happened to me on every stay at this place and they really need to get on their phone system. All that said, I'd still go back. I love beautiful design and this place has it. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and there's plenty of space to spread out. Fix a few things with the staff and it's a total winner.

Reviews.Title: “New gem if you're looking to stay within Napa”
Reviews.Author: JazzyJas
Reviews.Content: A great little gem that is relatively new in Napa, a relatively quiet town. Would be a good place to start out from if you're exploring the wineries around the area. I do have to say we didn't spend very much time in the hotel, and didn't check out the rest of the hotel beyond the lobby and the room. Pluses: Modern yet cozy little hotel, under 150 room hotel. Bathroom size was relatively large, as compared to room size. Free parking! Parking garage is a few minutes walk away Seems to be a huge store right next to the parking garage, and there's a safeway a couple blocks away. Minuses: One of the rare hotels that didn't provide bedroom slippers. Hotel room is kind of small in size, but then again, that was already expected

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value; beautiful ADA room”
Reviews.Author: jeane00
Reviews.Content: Most of Avia's rooms are ADA and I strongly suggest asking for one even if you're not disabled - plenty of room and a very nice layout, especially in the bathrooms. Note there are different layouts so check in early and make sure you like what you see, or ask for another room. There was some background mechanical noise at night, but nothing outrageous. Hotel is no noisier than any other these days; you have to pay a lot of money for a soundproofed room these days! Decor is good and location is outstanding. So far this is the best value on the Napa side of the Wine Country and ideal for exploring the area. Self-parking is free on third floor of garage right behind the hotel, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Sojourny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a day with my partner while visiting Napa. I wanted to be in downtown Napa and this hotel was conveniently located in the heart of Napa. I will say the young people at the front desk were nice but not very helpful. Although the main reason I am writing is because they charged my card $300.00. When I called a week later to ask why they claimed I had been smoking in my room. I then asked to speak to a manager and when she was unavailable I left a message. They never called back, and I called them about 6 more times over the course of the week. I never could get a hold of the manager and the people I did speak with told me they would leave a message. The only thing I was told was that the Engineer had proof (which is absurd seeing as I didn't smoke in my room). I did have one of the rooms with a balcony which I did use to smoke and i'm assuming someone saw me and complained. Anyways they said they had to speak with the Engineer and of course they never called me back. If they really had any proof I'm sure they would have called me back, but I was very surprised at the lack of resolve they had to do anything at all. After leaving four messages you would think someone would take the time to talk to a customer. Very disappointed with the overall service from AVIA!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique that Does not Sacrifice on Comfort”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCDN_travlr
Reviews.Content: I love staying in boutique hotels but many times, they fall short by trying to be too cool. The AVIA Napa, however, is the perfect balance of chic and comfort. The hotel lobby is bright and inviting but also oozes character. The rooms were extremely comfortable, with huge washrooms that featured a huge double-wide shower, hands down my favourite feature. The room itself had hardwood floors and free in-room wifi. Free parking was available at a parking lot right beside the hotel. Everything in downtown Napa was within walking distance. I would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: LWilson11
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice to stay at Avia. I am big on location and this was a great one. We are able to walk to dinner and various bars both nights of our stay. We received an upgraded room upon our arrival! It was clean and roomy ( i didn't even use the extra sheets I brought). The wood floors made it seem cleaner than hotel carpet. We will stay there again when we visit the area! Check out the restaurant across the street too.... great burgers!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: MassGuy2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and had a wonderful stay. Hotel staff was great. Room was great. Got a great deal on expedia.com. Only complaint was the hotel is wine and beer only. Not a huge deal, but drinking so much wine all week in Napa, wanted something different. But there are plenty of places very close to satisfy that need. They did say that would be changing soon and would have a full bar. You can bring your own wine onto the terrace which is great. Lots of nice places to sit and nicely landscaped too. Great spot. Hotel is a little ride to all the vineyards (15-20 minutes), but you can walk to all the restaurants and bars which is very nice. Vallet is reasonably priced at $15 a night and worth it. Parking garage is a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Helpful friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Stephl31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in may 2010 for a few nights...Its a beautiful hotel very clean and in a great location! So close to all the wineries! The staff were very helpful and suggested some great wineries to visit! The hotel room was decent size and I loved the bathroom!! awesome shower! We will definitely stay here again! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bathroom! Most relaxing overall : )”
Reviews.Author: ONEhAPPYgOLUCKY
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and super comfortable room. The king bed was amazing, firm yet plump & cozy. There's a wall that divides the room from a living room space with an extra T.V., with a fireplace that reaches both spaces, terrific! The bathroom is spectacular, both the shower and the soaking tub, which is actually in the bedroom. Highly recommendable. Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avia last week for 3 nights. We found the hotel well located in the town, modern, and the room larger than the hotels we stayed in San Francisco. We had everything we needed, the hotel has a nice classy feel to it, and it was perfect for our trip. We booked through Expedia, so the rate we paid was better than we achieved in San Fran as well. The bed was really comfortable. It was unfortunate that we found someone elses sock under it ! There is a terrace area on the second floor which is lovely, but there is no service there. You have to take your own drinks up. It was deserted when we were on it, although it was a beautiful day. Napa seems to be a place eveyone goes to for the weekend from the city. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant one evening, and were not particularly impressed by the food (we were the only diners), but that wasnt really a problem. The service was fine. Theres a steak house up the road called Coles which is a better choice. The bar has a great selection of wines as you would expect, but closes very early by UK standards. That seemed to be a general theme everywhere though. We booked in advance, outings with Beau Wines Tours and we went on the Wine Train - both well worth doing. We really enjoyed our trip to Napa, and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to end your day in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: StoneSouped
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just travelled to Napa for our 20th wedding anniversary and stayed at Avia. The rooms were clean and well appointed, but maybe a little small. Its located in downtown Napa and is an easy walking distance to many great restaurants, galleries, wine bars and the Oxbow Market. Our concierges, Pamela and Juliette , made our stay everything we hoped for and went above and beyond trying to help my wife with an unusual request. We will keep Avia in mind for our next visit to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jwpatt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and got a great deal. We were upgraded upon check-in for our honeymoon and we got a very spacious and well-decorated room with a gas fireplace. The service was great-- all the staff was friendly and and they refreshed our rooms more than once a day. The second floor terrace was beautiful, it had many different seating areas and a fire pit. All in all, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “we were told we were getting an upgrade and instead got the worst room at the level we paid for”
Reviews.Author: nycgal_11
Reviews.Content: my husband and i are on our honeymoon. at check-in we were told that they were giving us a room upgrade. we were super excited about it. we get to our room and it in fact is just the type of room we paid for - a lux suite. there's a king bed, small sitting area, desk, 2 tv's (one in front of the bed and one in front of the couch), and a regular bathroom (no tub). we were so disappointed to look out the doors and see that most of our view was blocked on both sides by the building. we had a very narrow view of some cars. forget even having a real balcony, the door wouldn't even open because the sitting area rug is so close (that's how small the sitting area is). we didn't even have a double vanity, which is the picture that's shown on the website for a lux suite. granted, the room is what we paid for, but for someone to tell us we are getting an upgrade and be given just the worst room available for the room level we paid for is awful (and somewhat misrepresented based on the double vanity photo on the hotel website). especially on our honeymoon! (which they knew).

Reviews.Title: “bad experience would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: between the 5 calls I had to make for coffee and the fire alarm being activated by our shower (and is still going off as I type this) I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff- A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: kak282
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avia Napa last weekend with my fiance and it was fantastic, great staff, great rooms, great location, wonderful concierge! The beds were amazing and the bathrooms were really well laid out (loved the shower). My only complaint was the housekeeping services, I was not impressed at all by the state of our room after it was cleaned. That said, I would not hesitate to stay here again, I am already itching to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent service and glorious concierge!”
Reviews.Author: alogan3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Avia, Napa with my boyfriend for our one year anniversary. Upon arrival the front desk attendant saw that we noted our anniversary upon booking and offered us a complimentary upgrade to our room and we happily accepted!
