Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short weekend trip to Napa for a friend's birthday. Loved the character and our room was nice and comfy. Breakfast buffett's (for $12-$16) were good with prices to be expected. Doormen, concierge and front desk were all super helpful and always friendly. Only downside is the location! The area where the hotel is located was too quiet for our taste. Not much going on, virtually no one around. We happened to be there during a beautiful weekend too, weather in the mid-70s with no rain or clouds.

Reviews.Title: “OK... just!”
Reviews.Author: DrRocketMan
Reviews.Content: At £145 ($220) per night for the Lux-tub room we expected this hotel to deliver... and largely our expectations were just about met. Firstly, on the upside, the location is very good both in terms of the position in Napa Valley and being central in Napa itself. The staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel and our room were clean and decorated very nicely to a high modern standard. We made use of the free standing bath-tub which was very nice. Parking was free on dedicated floors of the adjacent public car park. Also a big plus for me was the free wireless internet connection in our room. Actually I expect nothing less, so not so much of a big plus… but good avoidance of a large minus. Regardless… it’s always nice when you find it for free. Downsides were few and rank no higher than an irritation… worthy of a mention as “room for improvement” though and a suggestion that the room rate on our room for off season was set about 10% to 15% too high. Firstly our view (room 306) was of high brick walls about 5 to 10m from our window. We didn’t have the cheapest room and expected much better. Secondly the gym was very small and you couldn’t get on the running machines at peak times. As it happens we turned this into a positive by heading outside for a beautiful clear and crisp morning run along the river. However I wasn’t able to supplement this with any resistance work upon our return to the hotel due to the over-occupancy of the gym. Lastly watch out for the bathroom door arrangement. Ours was of a sliding nature leaving a large half-inch gap all the way around when closed which doesn’t provide for much in the way of acoustic privacy. This was of no consequence to my girlfriend and I but watch out if your relationship is still in the early stages of suppressing bodily announcements. To the hotel management… the design of your bathroom would readily facilitate a door across the toilet room allowing one person to be using the toilet while the other is in the shower or at the basin. In isolation and depending on your priorities none of the above rank higher than a minor annoyance or inconvenience and the hotel admirably serves the purpose of a safe refuge in a great location. We don’t spend much time in the hotel room itself whenever we travel and had a truly fantastic time in Napa and so should you… but if we ever went back, we’d probably just go for the cheapest room this hotel had to offer in an attempt to improve value for money.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Wendy056
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on TripAdvisor - super location - just opened in 2009 - beautiful rooms - big bathrooms with 2 sinks - came in handy as we were traveling with our 25 year old daughter. Loved that we had 2 King beds in our room - modern, lovely decor. Great wine hour each night - neat open area on 2nd floor roof with firepit and party cabanas. Could walk to our restaurants both nights - Cole's Chophouse (great steakhouse) and Allegria (great Italian). Took our own wine both nights to restaurants for small corkage fee. Would definitely stay here again. Two nice bars across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Ending of my Trip sorta ruined by Avia”
Reviews.Author: nyugirl2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avia hotel in Napa from the 25th to the 27th of April. The service was great MINUS the concierge desk. My boyfriend and I met with the lady working there, she took our credit card information and claimed to book a Napa Train tour for us. She printed us our confirmation form and told us to meet at the station about 15 minutes prior to boarding to pick up our tickets. We went to the train station and were told NO tickets were bought and paid for and that we can purchase NEW ones to get on the train. WE WERE TOLD THAT OUR TRIP WAS BOOK BY AVIA! Upset, I called the front desk at Napa and they blamed the train and the Train Company blamed Avia. Either way, the ending to our trip was ruined by not having gone on the train tour. This is upsetting on many levels, no one took responsibility for their actions or even tried to rectify the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: chrisonthetown
Reviews.Content: PROS: Modern, but still charming hotel. Clean, well designed rooms, big flat TV, comfortable bed, fridge with space for own drinks, large windows, IPod stand (we had the Lux Suite). Friendly, attentive staff. Good breakfast at reasonable price (compared to another venue down the block). Large outdoor terrace with free wine happy hour. Walking distance to bars (across the street too!) and some wonderful restaurants (Angele, Celadon). Free off-lobby internet computers Plenty of free parking at next door garage which was very convenient. CONS: No floor soda/water dispensers. Hotel restaurant doubles as their wine bar – not really the best atmosphere for a glass of wine. When planning a visit to Napa again, we will surely consider Avia.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Jenny496
Reviews.Content: Hotel-The hotel is very modern and has a great look. It has a restaurant/bar (which we didn’t try) and a really nice terrace area. The terrace has a fire pit an quite a bit of seating, so it’s a great place to hang out during the day or in the evenings. One thing to note is that there is currently some construction going on. It didn't really interfere with our stay, but it could get a little loud during the day. Room-The rooms were very nice and had great amenities. The bathrooms were very nice and there was a huge tub to relax in. The room we stayed in was separated into a bedroom area and a living room area, which was nice. Location- The hotel is located in downtown Napa, and is within walking distance to several restaurants, such as the Bounty Hunter. The downtown Napa area is cute and the hotel is right in the middle of everything. This area is about 15 minutes away from Yountville, where a lot of the larger wineries are. Service-Service was always friendly, but not always very efficient. We were missing a few things from our room (room service menu, wine glasses, etc.), and we had to make three calls over two days before everything was delivered. Not a huge deal, but we would have expected more attentive and efficient service from this caliber of hotel. Overall, the AVIA was a nice, modern hotel in a good location that is definitely well-priced compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel. Great for the money.”
Reviews.Author: martinridge
Reviews.Content: Just by walking through the front door.... you know you have made the right choice. First of all it's in the heart of downtown Napa. It's within walking distance of several great restaurants and bars. A great starting off point to head north on your wine tasting adventures. We arrived to the hotel a few days after they had a large water line burst and flooded the ground floor ( lobby ) with two inches of water warping the floors. They were in the process of attempting to restore the wood floors when we arrived so there was a bit of construction going on, but so what..... things happen. I heard several people mention that the floors actually looked very rustic because of the warping. Any way, it wasn't a big deal. Check in went smoothly and everyone we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. There is free self parking at the back of the the hotel with a very short walk to the front door or a $15 valet fee per day with all the in and out privileges you need. The room we had was on the 5th floor. 519. Right next to the elevators. We could never hear the elevators or anyone out in front of them so it was never a problem. But we could hear the people on the other side of the elevators, which again wasn't a problem for us because it was my sister. But if you didn't like listening to my sister and brother in law laughing.... it may be a problem. The rooms are Fantastic!!!! They are very large (we had a Luxe room) nice hardwood floors, swivel TV so you could watch it while in bed or while watching it in the sitting area that has a small couch. Very comfortable king size bed with comfortable crisp sheets. There is a large bathroom with one sink and plenty of counter space. There is a lighted magnified mirror. Ladies... Don't look deeply into this!!!!!! You will scream and run for the tweezers! But... do what you gotta do! The shower has two shower heads, one rain head shower and a hand held shower head. Our water was as hot as you want for as long as you want. The only complaint or suggestion would be about the open shower area. there is just small glass pane that really doesn't keep any of the water in the shower. So just make sure you have 2 or 3 towels down to soak up the water and keep you from slipping and breaking you neck while getting out of the shower. I didn't have a problem wiping up the water, but you shouldn't have to and I can see some people really complaining about this. The view from our 5th floor room was of the parking structure at the rear of the hotel. beautiful.... no but we really didn't spend that much time looking out at the views. We were there for the room. If I'm going to get an amazing view, it's probably not going to be for the price I paid for this hotel which was a bit over $200. They had a very nice outdoor area with wood swings and rocking chairs surrounding a large fire pit and the second floor. We spent a very nice evening around this fire pit and met some very nice interesting people. They is a very great breakfast buffet for around $20 per person. Eggs, omeletts, bagels, muffins, fruits, cereals, meats, cheeses, yogurts and all kinds of other wonderful filling things. In the evening they have a complimentary wine tasting with a few appetizers. In the morning the have a coffee station set up in the lobby if you would like to take a coffee on the go. Over all, myself and all my companions who stayed here had nothing bad to say about this hotel. We were very pleased and felt like we got a great deal for the price. I did a lot of research on hotels and bed and breakfasts in the area and thought that this looked like the nicest hotel for the price. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not geographically desirable”
Reviews.Author: zarne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 2 nights and our experience was good overall, but with a few kinks. Although the downtown area of Napa is experiencing a bit of a renaissance, they still have a long way to go and the town is still a bit boring. So, I'd probably wouldn't stay here again for another year or two while the city is still in transition. Secondly, it is quite a distance from all the wineries and restaurants (the city of Napa has mediocre dining) and we ended up driving about 30 minutes every night to get to our dining destinations in St. Helena. Not to mention the wineries are a bit of a drive to get to as well. I also thought the price we paid for our Master Suite with tub was a bit high considering these factors mentioned above. The staff was nice but when we requested a different room because our view was a concrete wall, the desk staff was unwilling to move us, claiming a full house. When I phoned the manager, she moved us righ away to a much brighter room - which we certainly appreciated. Although their were some good features I enjoyed during my stay, I feel the hotel and the downtown area have a long way to go before I would consider staying their again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect--no complaints”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an extended weekend in Napa. Found this hotel on jetsetter.com and got it for a great rate. It was a great deal and well worth it. I truly have no complaints about this hotel. The location is within walking distance to many restaurants. You are right down the road from Hwy 29 so very convenient when departing the hotel for you daily wine tour. The hotel is new so obviously very clean. The fitness center was good--not perfect but I talked to one of the owners and he was going to make some changes. The lobby smells wonderful and the staff was great. They do little wine tastings each evening at 5pm. We only made it to one but it was lovely. The outdoor terrace and fire pit were great too. So much fun to sit out there and relax. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Except for brief interaction on arrival, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: gatordiner
Reviews.Content: arrived easter sunday. as our first trip to napa, we arrived a little later than intended due to traffic and bad weather. they had a special wine tasting in the restaurant that had ended ten minutes before our arrival. I inquired about doing the tasting but was told that it was over and we were too late (ten minutes literally). Otherwise the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was modern and nice. Good location if you want to stay in the city. I would not recommend it if you are driving and want to do a lot of wine tastings as the distances can be far from one winery to another (something we did not realize until we arrived) . It is about 30 miles to get to Sterling Vineyards from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sbpierson
Reviews.Content: Brand new, contemporary hotel. I got an incredible suite with fireplace and a huge bathtub, but all rooms are very nice. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “one of the better hotels”
Reviews.Author: ash1394
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at a good location. I would stay here again. It was relatively quiet for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Modern”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl8
Reviews.Content: When we were there the hotel had only been open for a couple months; so obviosly everything was new. It was very clean and quiet. Good location. There was a Restaruant in the hotel but we didn't try it. One thing to note, the shower has no door. Worried about water on floor/slipping.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Avia for two nights for a little staycation. We were very pleased with the hotel. Although we paid a very low rate ($157 per night, I think-- California resident special on the hotel's web site), we had a suite with a separate sitting room. The room was very luxurious and had a safe, two flatscreen TV's, an excellent shower with a rain feature, and a very comfortable bed - not too firm and not too soft. We both slept very well there. Avia is very well located in downtown Napa and you can walk to several excellent restaurants (Norman Rose and Bounty Hunter are two that we tried and liked), tasting rooms and Silo's jazz club. The staff is very helpful with great recommendations on where to eat and what to do. We will definitely be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Modern yet homey boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PYL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a short get away after all the hustle and bustle of the Valentine and Chinese New Year weekend. We are not big on wine tasting, and just wanted a nice and quiet hotel with good restaurants within walkable distance. Avia was the ideal place. We had a tub and fireplace suite, and had a fantastic time. The hotel was very quiet and the deco was modern without being overly pretentious. The check-in was efficient and the receptionist gave us helpful dinning suggestions. There are plenty of good eateries within a few block radius. We especially enjoyed the desserts at Sweetie Pie and the entrees at Celadon. The food at Celadon was excellent, and the prices were very reasonable. We sat next to the fire place and had a casual but romantic dinner. Although we did not order any alcohol, the server gave us excellent service, and really deserved the generous tip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but probably will try and stay closer to Yountville next time”
Reviews.Author: ASYAmanda
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Location was pretty much the only downside to this hotel. I wish it were closer to downtown Yountville instead of downtown Napa. It was a little far to drive back and forth to the wineries/dinner (about 25 minutes). There isn’t much to see in downtown Napa besides a handful of restaurants and the river. HOTEL: The hotel is small but very modern and nicely decorated. The outdoor patio has a large fire pit and is a great place to relax after a long day. SERVICE: Check in and out was a breeze (would have been nice to have had e-checkout though). Everyone was helpful and friendly! They even gave everyone Valentine ’s Day cookies on the 14th which was a very nice treat! ROOM: We stayed in a master suit with a tub and fireplace/sitting area. Everything was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was huge with double sinks and a rain shower. The bathtub (as others have said) was luxurious and very relaxing. The king bed was very comfortable and it was very quiet. INTERNET: Free wifi throughout the hotel! GYM: The gym was small and had no windows to the outside but otherwise was nice and had brand new cardio machines and free weights. There was also a flat screen TV, water and towels. I would suggest to the management that they put a fan in the room as it can get rather hot and stuffy especially when there are a lot of people. SECURITY: I felt very safe in this hotel. There were large safes in the rooms big enough to hold my laptop which was great! Parking is okay, the self park (and valet park) is in a public parking structure behind the hotel. The top levels are reserved for guests only but the structure is otherwise open to the public. OVERALL: Overall I truly enjoyed my stay at Avia. The room was exactly as we expected and we had a relaxing vacation. The only drawback for us was the location as we would have preferred to stay somewhere a little closer to wine country activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Avia”
Reviews.Author: nickel5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at the Avia in Napa and couldn't have had a more wonderful time. The hotel was beautiful and there is not 1 complaint that we had. We did get the smallest room, but it was fine considering that we didn't spend a lot of time in the room but instead wine tasting and going to great restaurants. The first night we ate a couple of blocks down at Ristorante Alegria--YUMMY!!!!!!!!!!!!! It was such a great meal. The second night was Cole's Chophouse--Ok food, but after an hour wait for a table and then another hour wait for our food, I was very disappointed--and VERY pricey! Our 3rd night, we wanted to relax, so we did something we never thought we would do--(based on recommendations here on TA) we walked a couple of blocks over to Val's Liquor (yes a Liquor store) and got take our at Clemente's Italian Rest. It was THE BEST and CHEAP!!!! The malfati (interesting story behind the dish) was the most wonderful italian food. They only do take out, so we went back to the 2nd floor and had our dinner on the deck and then sat by the fire pit for the next few hours and met many wonderful people from all over the country. We then went across the street to the bar/rest.--forgot the name and watched the Olympics and closed down the place. The BEST part of the Avia is the staff!!!!! Scott Diaz (rest. manager) was the most wonderful person that we have ever met in a hotel. He was so knowledgeable about the wineries to tour and about wine itself. He always remembered our names and ALWAYS went out of his way to make us feel very important! He was always there, so I'm not sure when he ever got time off. The Avia is truly blessed to have an employee like Scott, and I only wish that we lived closer because he could truly be someone we would love to hang out with! We are already planning on going back next year for our 20th Anniversary and we will stay at the Avia AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little thoughtfulness could go a long way!”
Reviews.Author: sisterjc
Reviews.Content: Told the hotel it was hubby's 50th surprise trip with friends and wanted quiet rooms away from the elevator. Away they were - all the way down at end of hallway, but right above the trash pickup. We were woken up every morning by trash pickup at 6:30! Kind of disappointed that a little more thoughtfulness could have been used by the hotel staff who assigned the rooms. Other wise, the concierge was great, the wine tasting was an added bonus, and the rooms were super clean and hip. If you have the money, get a suite because the regular rooms are very small as other visitors have indicated. Hotel charged us for a bottle water eventhough we didn't consume any, so do pay attention to your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable staycation, great value!”
Reviews.Author: scoshi
Reviews.Content: This being our first time to Napa, I researched for weeks before finally making a decision on Avia. Even after, I was second guessing myself. We've stayed in new hotels and have not always had comfortable stays but since it's been open for several months, we hoped for the best. We couldn't pass up the great value! The nightly rate averaged $147 a night including weekends with the "staycation" package for California residents. Wow, what a deal that was! Even w/o breakfast included, we felt we got our monies worth and even more. The check in isn't until 4 but our room was ready when we arrived around 1:30 and they even upgraded us to Lux Suite which has the double facing fireplace warming up both the luxurious bedroom and the living room. It was my b-day weekend and my father had ordered us a bottle of champagne which was waiting for us when we entered the room. Always a wonderful way to enter a hotel room! As if that wasn't wonderful enough, we were quickly taken with our room. So simple but elegant and luxurious. Loved the bathroom large enough for us to shower together, the double sinks and the lighting and cleanliness of it all was just perfect. We were on the 3rd floor facing the street but we were never bothered with noise in or out of the hotel. We had breakfast in the hotel the first morning. It was good but we found other places near the hotel that was better and much less expensive. The lady at the concierge desk really knows her restaurants. She recommended the 2 breakfast spots which we loved and a cute little place for lunch, Gracie's Table (I think). Excellent service and food! The evening wine was a lot of fun. But we didn't take advantage of it enough. There's just so much to do, taste, drink in Napa that we only participated on our first day. Next time...There will be a next time! Avia, as new as it is, they have really worked out their little glitches. The service was impeccable through out. I still can't get over the value. Because we saved from accommodations, we splurged with wonderful dinners at La Toque (highly recommended) and Bistro Jeanty. It was a wonderful birthday weekend, one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “High Californian hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Stevev98
Reviews.Content: My stay was for 5 nights, attending a business conference. The hotel was very welcoming and the friendly barman provided a great supper in the open-plan restaurant bar, which proved an excellent antidote for the 12-hour flight from London to San Francisco. Much better than the welcome offered by most British hotels! The standard room was comfortable and modern, with plenty of room and a fantastic bathroom with huge shower. All conveniences provided: coffee maker, safe, iPod-docking radio, air-con, ironing board, mini-bar and free WiFi internet. The bed was huge and provided a great sleep - despite jet-lag! My only slight niggles were: 1. the air-con which, as the only heater for the room in winter, was a little noisy at night. I solved the problem by heating the room up and then switching it off before going to bed. Not a big problem though. 2. If you move anything in the mini-bar they'll automatically add something to your bill. We like fresh milk in our coffee and put a carton in the bar to keep cool. This confused their system - but it was soon smoothed out when we checked out. Everything else was fine, clean and well-maintained. The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere with a large skylight over a large communal table in the centre and lots of comfortable seating and tables round the room. The conference room was well designed and kept us all awake for 3 days! I should mention the hotel concierge especially. She was extra helpful with finding out about local sightseeing, shopping and a tricky car hire arrangement which she managed with aplomb. We enjoyed our stay at the Avia, both for business and as a base for exploring the beautiful Napa wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, wonderful service, amazing amazing bath.”
Reviews.Author: sydney1976
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in and around Napa quite a bit. I was pleased to try this newer hotel this time around. The location is great and the room AMAZING. The price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DoctorFishFace
Reviews.Content: It was my 33rd birthday, and a couple girlfriends and I decided to go to Napa. We looked online at hotels, and decided to try out Avia. When I was looking online, they were advertising the Napa Staycation if you were a resident of Ca (which was a 25% discount of their regular prices). Excellent! By the time I got around to booking it, it was 4 days later, and unfortunately the deal was no longer on their website. I called the hotel just to check if they were still doing it, and they called me right back, and honored the deal I had found on their website a few days earlier. Sweet! We got to the hotel, and everything was beautiful. The lobby feels modern, yet warm, and the staff were friendly and accommodating. We had the Master Suite with Tub with fireplace, it was perfect for 3 gals. The bathroom is plenty big, with a huge rain shower, and as it was rainy and cold, the fireplace was much needed. About 15 minutes into our stay, we got a call from the concierge confirming it was my birthday, and then Juliette from the hotel stopped by with a vase of roses requested by my husband. The most amazing thing is, Juliette went to the local grocery store, (as my husband didn't want to spend the $70 charged by the local florists for a dozen roses), bought a dozen gorgeous red roses, and arranged them herself in a vase for me. How awesome is that? What hotel would go that far out of their way to do that???Thank you Juilette!!!! And then a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries arrived (also courtesy of my fabulous husband) but they were soooo yummy! The bartender was also very friendly and gave us a great recommendation for some merlot, and stuck around the bar despite us being the only ones there. Needless to say, we had an excellent time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: erin120
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here Thanksgiving weekend for our 2 year annivesary but I have been too busy to write the review until now. We checked in Thanksgiving day and they had sangria and lemonade in the lobby. Nice touch. The staff was very friendly and informed us of their Thanksgiving dinner which was 3 courses. We decided to give it a try as we had no plans for that night and it was the best meal we had the whole trip. We even ate at Celedon and La Toque! Overall the service was fantastic the whole time. We had room service once and the buffet once for breakfast. The one thing I would add for breafast would be pancakes or french toast but everything else was yummy. The room was very nice and I loved the bathtub - it came with bubble bath. We had the master tub suite with fireplace. The shower was huge but it needed a door. It felt kind of weird showering with no door. I liked the two sinks though. The extra living room space was nice for breakfast/room service in the morning. The bed was very comfortable and I liked how the windows opened. They even gave us a bottle of wine upon our arrival - again a nice touch. Overall I LOVED this hotel and would stay again. My only tiny tiny complaint is that they gave us bubble bath on the first day but didn't restock it so we ran out but other than that it was great. The hotel is beautiful and I loved the decor.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: citonyc
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel fairly late at night due to delays by the airlines, but we called ahead and the friendly staff were informed of our delay.. we stayed at the hotel only a few short months after its opening and if i could describe it in one word..WOW !! the hotel is amazing.. the surrounding area is in the heart of napa but still up and coming, there were many of new business( store fronts) buildings that were vacant. the staff was very nice and polite and the concierge station was extreamly helpful in planning some great wine tours, they even gave us free sampling cards of other local shops and winemakers. the patio area has a fireplace which is great for enjoying a bottle of wine and winding down after a long day. the rooms were very nice, clean and had a safe in each room along with flat screen tv and a incredibly big walk in shower!! valley parking is expensive but there is a free parking garage literally right behind the hotel !! ( 30 second walk if you go out thru the dinning room exit ) altho you must park on the 3rd floor for free overnight parking. you will get towed on the first 2 floors!! hotel prices were little on the steep side but it is Napa Valley !! i would absolutely stay at this hotel again.. also anyone planning a trip to Napa .. the wine train dinner is a must !! great 4 course meal with a relaxing view of the Napa countryside

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Friendly, Conscientious Service.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during The Holidays. Our room was the master tub suite with a private balcony. Yummy room-service hamburger and turkey club. Convenient location; walking distance to Celadon, the Wine Train, and the Public Marketplace. Free self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but the service has some rough edges.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall we really enjoyed the hotel and think the decor and theme is well done. The food and housekeeping staff were attentive. We were disappointed with the concierge services. I sent an e-mail seeking information prior to our arrival and never received information back. Once we arrived we were told information would be placed under our door. This also never occurred and we were told she didn't " get around to it."

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: Golf_wine_lover
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. It's brand new, clean and comfortable, right in the town of Napa. We had a "tub" room, which I understand is a bit larger than other rooms there. Extremely modern and large bathroom (2 sinks, 2 showerheads). 2 flat screen HD TV's, fireplace that serves both bedroom and sitting room. Valet parking was quick and smooth. Breakfast abundant and tasty with choice of very large "continental" or full service buffet. Great coffee station in lobby early every morning with afternoon cold/hot seasonal drinks in afternoon. We did NOT use the restaurant for lunch or dinner but did get room service once and it was prompt and the food was very good. This hotel is easy walking distance to almost all town restaurants, shops and wine bars. Booked on Expedia with a non-refundable rate bundled with a SFO rental car.

Reviews.Title: “South Beach in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Bchtravlr
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice modern hotel with plenty of comforts and style! The public dining and common areas are very comfortable! The room was very large, with a extremely comfortable bed and pillows. We will definitely be back again on our next trip!.. We spend over 100 nights a year in multiple levels of hotel rooms for business, so having a great room on leisure travel was very important! Our experience with the staff was very positive. They did everything they could to help! Be sure to use Maria at Concierge, She will complete your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel ..... with a broken motel 6 style heater?”
Reviews.Author: MCTAI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a Suite with firplace and tub PLUS: ++Contemporary (boutique) style room, very comfy and clean and roomy ++ Awesome tub and shower... huge bathroom ++ Fireplace, works well to heat the room (turns out to be our only heating source) ++ Fridge with drinks with sensors to know you took a drink and automatically charge you ++ Nice lighting ++ Comfy bed with too many pillows ++ Free WIFI ++ Friendly hotel workers that says hello MINUS: - Room view of parking structure... ok not too bad - Bathroom is made of stone and NOT heated...... so very cold inside!!! - 1 too many HDTVs... (do you really need so many?) - TV mounted over fireplace.. too hot for TV...... so had to be mounted WAY too high for viewing (FAIL) - NO pricelist for the in room drinks and snacks.... (althought it's only $2 for a soda) but still, you should let customer know what they are paying - I dont really trust the kids out front to valet my car. Hire someone a bit more mature maybe? MAJOR FAIL: --- For a hotel that is to be contemporary.... they have a heater system that is located inside the room much like a motel 6. It's VERY noisy and it was BROKEN. It's a brand new hotel... mmm, central a/c system?? We spend the night sort of cold and later had to turn the fire place on to heat the room... but then since it's not controlled... the room was over heated.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime!.”
Reviews.Author: wineloverMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Avia hotel during our short stay in Napa. The moment I entered the hotel I was in awe of the decor and knew instantly that it was the perfect hotel choice. We travel frequently and my hotel expectations are quite high and the Avia hotel exceeded them. It was an amazing place to celebrate our 10 year anniversary! My only regret is that we didn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Avia...Will saty again”
Reviews.Author: memewing
Reviews.Content: My friends and I thought the rooms were very well appointed and spacious for the price. I stayed in the Governors Suite and it was perfect. Very nice terrace. If you choose this room ask for one that does not over look the front of the building. My terrace was across from a bank and I could see into the second floor offices. The breakfast is quick and convenient with an omelet station, fresh fruit and steel cut oats. Enjoyed walking through town in the mornings. It is a shame that so many of the shops have closed. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern new hotel located within walking distance to restaurants and shops”
Reviews.Author: NJOtto13
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor and read good things. We wanted to stay within walking distance to restaurants and shops and the location was excellent. The atmosphere is very modern and contemporary. It's very inviting when you walk in. Our room was small but fit our needs as we stayed for 2 nights. The bathroom was roomy and had an oversized shower. Overall the hotel was clean and we would definetely stay here or at another Avia again.

Reviews.Title: “They're getting there...”
Reviews.Author: OxonTC
Reviews.Content: After a few mishaps on booking (double bookings, no communications - see previous review), I got to the hotel - great location and great looking hotel. Due to the hassles I'd had - they finally upgraded me to Presedential Suite - which was lovely. Its def has a few creaks to be ironed out, as a new hotel - bar staff over eagar with the bill, when you'd like to relax and have another drink. Food choice is very limited - but you're right by loads of places to eat - so not real issue... and still communication between staff not working quite right. Concerige was very very helpful - sorted me out with a great Wine tour and massage. Has the makings of an excellent hotel is they iron out the creaks.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame”
Reviews.Author: travlinman2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel two times. The first time my wife and I stayed here the food and service were excellent. The chef came to the table and talked to us and checked on how everything was. The second time was last week. It was very poor; while the front desk was very courteous and the bell staff was great too, the restaurant staff was unwelcoming and the chef was very cold. I am guessing that you have a new chef. The "sous chef" was agressive and not kind to his staff; we could hear him at the back of the dining room. Then we had the misfortune of running into the GM at check out. I didn't get her name nor did I wish to speak with her, so very rude, I've never seen someone berate her staff in such a way as to make it seem that she was caring all the while belittling them. If this were one of my employees I would have serious reservations about her, and putting her in front of guests. Her poor attempt at southern charm was offending as I am from the south. In closing I would like to say go back to opening staff, you had a winning crew there. If you stay with what you have, you're doomed to be nothing more than a mediocre, over priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very well done”
Reviews.Author: particleboardpigeon
Reviews.Content: The Avia in Napa is brand new. It's in a great location, within walking distance to restaurants and bars, and it makes a nice home base for wine country exploring. The staff was friendly, although they did forget a few things. Our room was spotless and roomy. It had a clean, contemporary look, vaguely Japanese (maybe it was the sliding bathroom door). The bathroom was terrific and had a nice tile tub with a shower head in the ceiling and another hand held shower head if you needed it. It also had a doublesink which is nice when you're traveling with a companion. The room had two large flat screen TVs, although we never turned them on. Wireless was complementary. The hotel also has a restaurant and bar. A local winemaker was pouring sample glasses. We enjoyed some small plates a few glasses. The service was very slow. We also probably overpaid for valet parking. I believe that free parking is available, which I found out after booking with the valet package included. The downside is that it's not cheap, but very little is in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Grundlegibson
Reviews.Content: I am a very demanding traveller and the AVIA exceeded my expectations with the delivery of a 5 star hotel experience at a 3 star rate. Beautiful new hotel with outstanding room amenities (double sided fireplace, huge flatscreen TV's, tasteful and modern decoration, comfy beds etc.). Concierge was very helpful, connected and knowledgeable and it became readily apparent that she truly cares about the guests' experience in Napa. Restaurant recommendations were "spot on" and she booked us on a truly memorable, first class tour of the Napa Valley (at a fraction of the price and hassle of what we could have arranged ourselves). An all round excellent experience here.

Reviews.Title: “A good pick for a night or two in Napa”
Reviews.Author: viajera725
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of days ago for a visit to Napa. The hotel is gorgeous-- modern design and very nice rooms (comfy beds). The valet, door, and front desk staff were very attentive, but the wait staff in the restaurant could have used some lessons from them. Had breakfast there and, though the food was good, the service was inattentive. I still give the hotel 5 stars, though, because everything else was A+

Reviews.Title: “Hip to the Max”
Reviews.Author: Lasallian
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for $114 I believe. Considering how much I've spent to stay at a Comfort Inn in my day, definitely great value! This is a new hotel, and it looks like a condo complex from the outside. Inside, its gorgeously hip! The decor is super modern, but still feels very comfortable. The staff were helpful, and the valet parking guys were friendly and always opened the front door on our way in and out. The conceierge was helpful in helping us figure out which wineries were worth a visit. The room was definitely not huge, but felt more like a big city apartment than a hotel. It had a huge flat screen tv, sumptuous king bed, hardwood floors, area rug, a seeting area, ipod dock, dean and deluca snacks in the mini-bar, wine glasses (a must in Napa) and the coziest blanket I've ever cuddled up in on the bed. The bathroom was quite large, and had a rain showerhead as well as a regular one, and a seat in the huge shower that could fit 5 (very friendly) people (no tub though if you're a bath person). There was an outdoor patio area on our floor (with propane heaters) which I believe is normally open for guest use, but we didn't get to check it out, as there was a function going on during our one night stay. The hallyways are dark and atmospheric, and all the rooms have a doorbell to complete the apartment feel. Definitely a great hotel for couples. If our room is incdicative of all the room sizes, might not be the best for a family. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: R_Cary
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Avia Hotel in Napa. It is close to downtown Napa and is new with a very modern look and feel.

Reviews.Title: “Avia Napa is Hip and Relaxed”
Reviews.Author: mermrcm
Reviews.Content: The ambiance is cool, the surroundings in the room are very comfortable. The service at breakfast is leisurely--plan some extra time if you are taking a 10:30 wine train. You will need and hour at least for breakfast. The workout room is compact yet nice. The staff is helpful but not over bearing. The parking garage that is attached is ok but the elevator is broken so make sure you take your luggage out first and then go and park.

Reviews.Title: “AVIA - Modern Luxury in the heart of NAPA”
Reviews.Author: mitsu6681
Reviews.Content: We chose AVIA since it was one of the newer hotels in NAPA, and we stayed here on the last day of our trip in Napa valley. The hotel was very modern and the staff could not have been nicer. The rooms are amazing (tub, HUGE shower, 2 flat screen TV's, fireplace...). The free sampling of wine and food at 5 PM was awesome, and in the evenings the outdoor patio was amazing - with full food and beverage service. Chocolate cake = amazing! Huge fire to sit around, and great atmosphere. Hotel is very close to everything in the city and we would definitely come here again on a return trip to Napa valley!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel in the heart of the town of Napa”
Reviews.Author: markjay
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days. Excellent hotel with courteous staff, a beautiful large ultra-modern bedroom, free self-parking, and a free upgrade to a complimentary full buffet breakfast. This is an excellent choice as a base for touring the Napa Valley. We ate dinner at Celadon, which we can also very highly recommend for food, service, ambience and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: GracieNebraska
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night recently at AVIA and were upgraded to a gorgeous room with fireplace and huge bathroom (I think we got a handicapped room). Front desk staff were very welcoming and the conceirge was extremely friendly and helpful. Third floor free parking was great. Trendy yet warm - the perfect getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great style and has potential for great service!”
Reviews.Author: Sammimarie
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel, very clean and has great potential. The staff could use some training however. And some quality control wouldn't hurt either. The problems we experienced were minor but annoying. A light was out in our bathroom, the coffee service was not replenished and there were no washcloths or hand towels. I mentioned this at checkout. I probably should have called it in during our stay but frankly - didn't housekeeping notice? We had not noticed the missing towels or coffee service until we actually needed them. I would stay here again, assuming our problems were due to the hotel being so new. The 2nd floor terrace was super and the location was really good. I think the staff just needs some seasoning as they were not very friendly at check-in or check-out. Kudos to the concierge though, who was able to get us dinner reservations at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: BNJ2009
Reviews.Content: Beginning: Vicky in reservations made sure we got our confirm even though it took several tries to get through the spam blocker. We requested a room away from the elevator and were placed at the very end of the hall (perfect). The hotel decor is hip and trendy and dark (reminds me of The Hotel at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas) and the standard rooms are VERY small and the layout is uncomfortable... you cannot roll the desk chair out as the area rug blocks it and after you are out there is about 6 inches of space between the bed and chair. The location is very good as you can walk to several spots in downtown Napa. The two drawbacks may not matter to you if you are here for wine (we were, but you need a break once in a while): no pool to sit and relax and the lack of a full bar. We did not avail ourselves of the staff as we are "do it ourselfers" using Trip Advisor and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected find in downtown Napa.”
Reviews.Author: Hergie
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel over the internet while planning our trip to Napa and we were quite pleased that it lived up to its pictures and details. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Maria, the concierge gave us good advice and was very helpful in pointing out where to go and what to see. We were upgraded to a suite with a soaking tub, and two-way fireplace, which added to the romance of the trip. The marble bathroom with the walk in shower was fabulous, but a little cold while showering. The buffet breakfast although tasty, was poorly staffed, and the wait at the omelette station took 30 minutes. The hotel is in downtown Napa, about 30 minutes from the wineries that are located along Hwy 29, so it's a bit of a drive. We stayed over Labor Day weekend and the city had a few events that were within walking distance of the hotel that we enjoyed. There are also several restaurants within walking distance, and we could walk to the Wine Train station for our lunch, which was very convenient. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel's facilities and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: btravelNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time at this hotel. The hotel was clean and very tastefully decorated. The concierge Maria was fabulous. She helped us to book a great tour to visit some of the wineries that was excellent. She recommended a small company that took out groups of four so that the tour had a private feel but was very reasonably priced. She also recommended several great restaurants and each one that we went to exceeded our expectations. The breakfast buffet while not extensive had just enough offerings to make it just right after a night of drinking and fine dining. The wait staff at the restaurant was extremely friendly and attentive. The chief chef was also very personable and took the time to answer questions about the menu. Don't miss the free tastings between 5-6PM. They are a great start to the evening or a nice way to wind down a long day. The location was great, several restaurants and sights were within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Napa's Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: LCordair
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find! Nestled in the heart of downtown is this "urban oasis" that delivers a warm and hospitable lodging experience. A definite departure from some of the "teddy bear and lace" experiences from previous trips, the AVIA Napa starts and ends with you feeling as if you were a long-lost member of the family, home for a short visit. The rooms are comfortable and inviting. Appointed with luxurious linens that covered one of the most comfortable beds that we have ever slept in. The bathrooms are bright and spacious with plenty of room for two. Our room had a lovely soaking tub and a large flat screen television. The restaurant only serves breakfast and lunch, which works out fine since most people are out wine tasting or shopping during the day. Breakfast was a feast for the eyes and the stomach, offering everything from steel cut oatmeal to perfect omelets. The dinner menu features a variety of delectable "small plates" with something for every palate. Everything was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Not A Five Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: mcorrallo
Reviews.Content: Avia is a beautiful facility and the room was very nice. But the staff is not up to the standards of the facility. We had a maintence person enter our room at 2:00pm unannounced while my wife and 3 year-old son were napping (he didn't realize we had checked in early). The waiter at the restaurant could not have been more ill-prepared for a fine dining experience. And when my wife left her Blackberry charger plugged into an outlet, they found it and then asked how would we like to pay for the shipping cost to return it (We paid $300 for the room. You can't spring for $3.00 in postage?). They need to either up their level of service or cut their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Uber satisfied”
Reviews.Author: HolmeGrown
Reviews.Content: I'm a winery tour guide, and my wife and I checked into AVIA wanting to be tourists in our own town for a night. I have to say I was VERY impressed. And this coming from a jaded local! The design is clean, stylish and modern without being sterile. All the staff members I came into contact with were cheerful and helpful. And the rooms were incredible! We opted for a suite and it was money well spent. Comfy beds, acres of bathroom countertop space and huge flat screen TVs. I'll be recommending AVIA to my guests for sure. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but they need to work out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: greengardener
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few weeks old and clearly they have problems that need to be worked out. I returned from a day of working to find that at 5pm my room had still not been cleaned. When I called the front desk they said they would send someone - the maids were still in the hall going from room to room at 5pm. Since I needed to get ready for the evening I said no - but would they take off something on the room rate. They said they could not but could only offer me a free continental breakfast. Not what I would say the equivalent of having a dirty room and unmade bed. When I came back to the room after dinner I turned on the Tv - which did not work. I called the front desk again and they said they would send someone up. In the meantime the maid turn down service ran the bell. the bell was a shrieking alarm that sounded like a fire alarm. Extremely loud.I thought we were evacuating the hotel. When I opened the door the maid tried to explain that I was in a handicapped room - which I am not sure why I was put in. When I called the front desk again after waiting awhile for the tv to be fixed I asked about this "bell". they said it was for the hearing impaired - hmm. On a lot of levels this doesn't work. Hearing impaired couldn't hear it and anyone that had hearing may have lost it with that shrieking bell. I could go on - hot water in the shower not really hot., food in the restaurant mediocre at best, very loud airconditioning in the room. Maybe they will work out the kinks - maybe not. I am still here typing this - I hope there will be nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “New, beautiful, modern”
Reviews.Author: MidwestWineLover
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and modern brand new hotel which opened on July 1st. We had a soaking tub in the room, very large bathroom, 2 flat screen TVs and fireplace. Staff all very helpful and welcoming. Parking is around the corner in a parking garage but you can self park. No pool or hot tub but passes to a nearby health club. Concierge very helpful with local winery info. Wouldn't recommend for families but very elegant and romantic for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Big, and Luxurious!!!”
Reviews.Author: thunderbballstud
Reviews.Content: This is a Brand New Hotel in Down Town Napa. The hotel is very beautiful and modern, the front desk people are very friendly and willing to help you out with everything. Beatuiful would be my words to describe it, everything in the hotel was so pretty. We stayed in the Lux King suite and it was the most amazing thing ever. the floor was a beautiful hardwood, and the bed was super comfy. You got robes to wear and the bathroom was gorgeous with a marble floor and shower with a waterfall shower head. The only down side was the room was very expensive and that did not include any of the refreshment bar that was stocked, anything you took out was charged to your room stay. Also the hallways were rather dimly light and there are no ice machines yet. They don't have a pool, spa, or workout room, but they do have a terrace with swings. :) The breakfast is an extra charge of $12.95 again something I was hoping would be included with the room. Other than that it was an amazing stay and I would recommend it to a friend, just with caution of being prepared to spend money.

Reviews.Title: “Veni, Vidi, Vici, Avia”
Reviews.Author: Perigrinator
Reviews.Content: The Avia Napa is an incredible hotel - we stayed there when they first opened and while there were some kinks to work out - they were just fantastic. From check in to check out, all went smoothly. The room we were in was great - roomy, spacious, hardwood floors, an all marble bath, the works. The staff was professional and aimed to please - they may be a bit green around the edges, but were friendly and helpful. I read the first review here and it may indicate some confusion - I asked for a pot of coffee and they had it at the door within 15 minutes - so not quite sure what happened w/ the first reviewer. We also went down for the heavenly breakfast which consisted of local ingredients, all freshly made. If the Avia continues to offer the service we had on our first visit, they will be successful - we have stayed at the Westin Verasa Napa (OK, but could use some service coaching) and the Napa River Inn (no complaints but the Avia is nicer), but Avia is just great.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential”
Reviews.Author: krb1622
Reviews.Content: The property is modern and attractive, and the rooms are spacious, with nice finishes. The bed was one of the most comfortable that I've ever experienced. The bathroom is large, with a long counter top for all my cosmetics and a shower big enough for two. I loved that we could open the windows and enjoy the gorgeous weather. The location is in central Napa, convenient to restaurants and tasting rooms. The Avia just opened last weekend and service is still pretty rough around the edges. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming, some of the staff was more accommodating than others. For example, one morning I asked if I could get a pot of coffee to bring to my room and was told "there's a coffee maker in your room." I knew that, but I wanted real coffee, with cream, and not that powdered cream substitute poison stuff. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. In general, it was a nice stay, but the service needs some refinement, which will probably come with time.
